title: Trends of Road Traffic Accidents
text:
Note



This blog utilizes accident data sourced from daily newspapers. It does not aim to substitute or dispute official police traffic reports. Instead, it aims to complement the existing narrative by providing additional context to the road traffic accident reports disseminated by the media. As such, any interpretation of these findings should be done with this context in mind.This monthly blog therefore seeks to provide patterns of major accidents on highways, given that the majority of such incidents are covered by the media

title: Trends of Road Traffic Accidents
section: Trend of Total Accidents Reported in Newspapers, 2021-2023,
text:
Trend of Total Accidents Reported in Newspapers, 2021-2023,
Nwespapers reported an average of 96 road crushes on highways over the 3 years under study.

title: Trends of Road Traffic Accidents
section: Trend of Total Accidents by Month
text:
Trend of Total Accidents by Month
There is an overall spike in the number of accidents were reported in May followed by November to December period.

title: Trends of Road Traffic Accidents
section: Trend of Total Accidents Reported by Month Faceted by Year
text:
Trend of Total Accidents Reported by Month Faceted by Year
There is a consistent marginal increase in road crushes reported by newspapers in May in all the 3 years under study.

title: Trends of Road Traffic Accidents
section: Total Number of Accidents Rported by Month by Type of Car Involved
text:
Total Number of Accidents Rported by Month by Type of Car Involved
Trucks registered the highest number of accidents consistent reported by newspapers over the 12 months of year.

title: Trends of Road Traffic Accidents
section: Total Number of Accidents Reported by Month by Type of Car Involved Faceted by Year
text:
Total Number of Accidents Reported by Month by Type of Car Involved Faceted by Year
Trucks registered the highest number of accidents consistent reported by newspapers over the 12 months of year in all the 3 years of study.

title: Trends of Road Traffic Accidents
section: Total Number of Accidents Reported by Time of Occurence
text:
Total Number of Accidents Reported by Time of Occurence
The highest proportion of accidents reported happened at 6 am in the morning.

title: Trends of Road Traffic Accidents
section: Total Number of Accidents Reported by Time of Occurence by car type
text:
Total Number of Accidents Reported by Time of Occurence by car type
Accidents occured most at 6am, this was consistent for most of the car types. Trucks had the highest number of road crushes happening at 6 am in the morning followed by Private cars

title: Trends of Road Traffic Accidents
section: Total Number of Accidents by month and accident type
text:
Total Number of Accidents by month and accident type
Most accidents happened at 6 am in the morning with cars overturning being the commonest type of accident. Atleast all accident type registered atleast 1 accident at 6 am in the morning.

title: Trends of Road Traffic Accidents
section: Total Number of Accidents by month and accident type over the three years
text:
Total Number of Accidents by month and accident type over the three years
Generally, most accidents happened at 6 am in the morning. Cars overturning was the most type of accident reported at 6 am over the 3 years under study.

title: Trends of Road Traffic Accidents
section: Total Number of Accidents by type and time of day
text:
Total Number of Accidents by type and time of day
Generally most head on collisions and cars ramming onto stationary trucks happened at night

title: Trends of Road Traffic Accidents
section: Total Number of Accidents by day of week
text:
Total Number of Accidents by day of week
Generally more road crushed were reported on Monday and Tuesday, with the least number of road crushes reported on a Saturday.

title: Trends of Road Traffic Accidents
section: Total Number of Accidents by day of week and time of day
text:
Total Number of Accidents by day of week and time of day
Most road crushes reported by newspapers occured on a Monday monrning.

title: Trends of Road Traffic Accidents
section: Total Number of Accidents by day of week over the three years
text: Total Number of Accidents by day of week over the three years

title: Trends of Road Traffic Accidents
section: Total Number of Accidents by day of week and time of day over the three years
text:
Total Number of Accidents by day of week and time of day over the three years
The prevalent occurrence of road crushes at 6 am in the morning is consistent over the three years under study. However, the consistency in days is only true on Monday mornings and spread ramdomly throught the days of the week when compared over the three years.

title: Hi, I’m Daniel Eurien.
text:
Hi, I’m Daniel Eurien.
I am an Epidemiologist and Data Scientist passionate about integrating data science into public health and small-to-medium enterprises to drive profitability. I love data visualization, machine learning, and applying natural language processing in business intelligence. Through this blog, I share my impactful public good projects using my newly acquired skills.
To get started, you can check out my most popular content below. You can find me on Twitter or GitHub and linkedin. Feel free to reach out to me via mail and subscribe to my email newsletter.

title: AI for Public Good Blog
text: This series contains a great deal of tips, tricks and packages that you can use to level up your ggplot game.

title: Process of data aquisition and model building
Process of data aquisition and model building
text: Natural Language Processing (NLP), a sub-field of Artificial Intelligence, offers an exciting opportunity to extract structured data from text to create a structured database. NLP can be trained to understand human language, enabling the extraction of valuable information from newspaper articles for further analysis. To delve deeper into NLP, you can read more about it in the article Natural Language Processing. In my own exploration of NLP, I utilized its capabilities by training a custom entity recognition model. This model allowed me to extract specific data from newspaper articles, making it easier to analyze and derive insights. To learn more about Named Entity Recognition (NER), which is a fundamental technique in NLP, you can refer to the article Named Entity Recognition.

title: Process of data aquisition and model building
section: Custom NER model training
text:
Custom NER model training
The schemer shows the nine step process of data aquisition and model training.












Figure 1: Process of Custom NER model training

title: Process of data aquisition and model building
section: How Named Entity Recognition Works

title: Process of data aquisition and model building
section: Process of annotation to fine tune the LLM
text:
Process of annotation to fine tune the LLM
I used a free online annotation tool called tecoholic to annotate 21 variables of interest using 150 newspaper articles that reported road traffic accidents in 2021. The trained model was the used to extract key variables from 300 newspaper articles from 2021 to 2023












Figure 2: Process of annotation

title: Process of data aquisition and model building
section: Performance of the model
text:
Performance of the model
The model performed well on unseen newspaper articles averaging 70% performance across all metrics:

ENTS_P: Precision score for named entities: measures the proportion of correctly identified named entities out of all predicted named entities. Higher values indicate better precision.
ENTS_R: Recall score for named entities: Recall measures the proportion of correctly identified named entities out of all actual named entities. Higher values indicate better recall.
ENTS_F: F1 score for named entities: measure of the model’s accuracy in identifying named entities, considering both precision and recall. Higher values indicate better performance.
SCORE: Represents an overall score: that combines multiple metrics to evaluate the performance of the NER pipeline. Higher values indicate better overall performance.










Model training results

title: Process of data aquisition and model building
section: Model deployment
text:
Model deployment
The final process was deployement of the model to 300 newspaper articles on road traffic accidents to obtain a structured dataset. ::: {layout-ncol=“1”}  :::

title: Process of data aquisition and model building
section: Implications
text:
Implications
The study’s insights on Named Entity Recognition (NER) performance in text mining have broad implications across various applications:

Information Extraction: Accurate NER enhances information extraction from unstructured text, benefiting tasks like news summarization, document analysis, and knowledge graph construction.
Knowledge Discovery: NER facilitates knowledge discovery by identifying and categorizing entities, supporting tasks such as trend analysis, market research, and social network analysis.
Search and Recommendation Systems: Integrating NER improves search and recommendation system accuracy by understanding user queries or preferences and providing targeted results.
Text Classification and Sentiment Analysis: NER contributes to text classification and sentiment analysis by identifying important entities, leading to more precise insights from text data.
Natural Language Understanding and Conversational AI: NER enhances natural language understanding and conversational AI systems by recognizing entities in user input, enabling better context understanding and response generation.
Data Integration and Linkage: NER aids data integration and linkage by identifying entities across datasets, supporting tasks like data harmonization and entity resolution for a unified data view.
NER as a Service: The study’s findings may lead to NER-as-a-service offerings, enabling organizations to leverage pre-trained NER models or APIs for streamlined integration into various systems and workflows.
